samples.question: [Transcript chunk 5]
samples.transcript: Please well i would love to describe about a time when i attended a wedding with my husband it was my cousin's wedding in punjab india and i remember that actually i did not remember the name of the place where i attended the wedding but it was a large palace and and when we entered the wedding there was loud music playing you know we call it dj so as i entered the wedding as as i entered the wedding i saw that there were lots of people there they were surrounding around the stage and the music was very loud and it was so loud that we cannot that we were not able to talk with one another you know it was like it was like my ears were bleeding it was so loud so literally when i just i just went to the gtj and i requested him to slow down the music a little bit because firstly it was not at all allowed to play such loud music in the center of the city and secondly it was late at night and you know in india there is a rule that after 11 pm you cannot play loud music so i just made him remember the rule so he finally he agreed but you know i still remember the type of music he was playing it was no i do not know it was not at all western and neither it was the cultural music it was someone it was something like a mixture of both so it was loud as well as tacky at the same time so yes that was the time the dj made a lot of noise and i did not like.

samples.transcript: Maybe their pitch is loud you know their pitch is high and they love speaking loudly and maybe you know some people are ignoring they do not know that sometimes it is better to speak softly or not to make noise not to disturb your neighbors it totally depends on person now you talked about the noise pollution in kind of weddings for example there is a lot of noise there do you think there should be some kind of regulation on the noise at weddings absolutely there should be some regulations and i think there are some regulations actually people are not following them properly as i said you know in india after 11 pm you cannot make noise or especially at the parties loud music is totally banned after 11 pm but there are many people who do not follow these regulations no maybe they find it funny or maybe they love to break certain rules so yes there are these regulations are necessary and we should follow them talking a bit about traffic noise that you have mentioned as well what can be done to reduce traffic noise actually this is really a major problem especially here in india you know a lot traffic is a huge cause of noise as well as of air pollution but according to me the the vehicles you know that operate on battery or electricity they can play a major role in reducing these types of noises and yes government is taking certain measures to do these things but there is a lot to be done more than that and what are the consequences of too much noise right yes there are certain consider consequences and some of them could be you know they are not.

samples.question: [Transcript chunk 2]
samples.transcript: Starts now okay so it was 2 years ago when I had my first experience with dookie it is a famous Korean restaurant back in my hometown at that time so it was on my 18th birthday I was just hanging out with my buddies so we hoped that it was a perfect day filled with happiness anyway my first impression with dookie was that we had to wait like up to two hours to just have a lunch there but that was totally fine after two hours I met the cashier but we was welcomed by an unwelcoming facial expressions of the Casher which made us felt feel really awkward in that situation okay but okay that was fine that was empathetic because they had a punch of clients to serve for so okay the back back to the food there we was served cult food and I continuously asked the waiter to refill the food for us but there was no response and the story went it to its climax when I ordered a seven up and it has a it had a weird Taste of like only water with gas so after all we just paid for the meal and went back home feeling so bad for the experience I also emailed to the dooky to complain about how terrible we experienced on that day well just in my perspective I think that customer service plays an a crucial role in like maintaining clients loyalty okay thank you.

samples.question: [Transcript chunk 3]
